title: What's a White Party and Where Did It Come From?

steps.title: A white party is an event where everyone wears white.
steps.content: A white party is an event where everyone wears white. All white parties have one thing in common: wearing all white. These parties can be fundraisers, birthday parties , circuit parties, or celebrations. The only requirement? White must be the color theme. [1] X Research source White parties are typically held in the spring and summer but aren’t limited to a specific season—white can be worn all year round! Why wear white? White is considered a color of purity and unity. [2] X Research source Because of this, white parties typically symbolize inclusion and community.

steps.title: The first white party may have been a fundraiser for HIV and AIDS.
steps.content: The first white party may have been a fundraiser for HIV and AIDS. In the 1980s, Frank Wager and Jorge Suarez created the first white party to raise money for charities for HIV/AIDS prevention and awareness. Guests were asked to wear white, and all proceeds from the event went to the cause. [3] X Research source

steps.title: In 1988, white parties became elegant celebrations in France.
steps.content: In 1988, white parties became elegant celebrations in France. François Pasquier hosted the first known white party in France called “Dîner en Blanc.” Over 10,000 guests were given a secret location the day of the party and told to wear white and have fun. Today, the tradition continues in France, and thousands of people gather every year for a night of elegance and good food.

steps.title: In the 90s, white parties were held to empower the Black community.
steps.content: In the 90s, white parties were held to empower the Black community. White parties became popular in the 1990s within Black communities because of Black celebrities and hip-hop moguls. Idols like Beyoncé, Lil’ Kim, LL Cool J, and Sean “Diddy” Combs helped put the glitz and glam of white parties on the map. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Today, white parties are thrown to bring awareness to equality.
steps.content: Today, white parties are thrown to bring awareness to equality. At the end of the day, white parties are about a sense of connection. They’ve been used to spread awareness about HIV/AIDS in the 80s and Black culture in the 90s. White parties today aren’t always thrown for specific causes (although many are still hosted for their original causes), but the essential theme stays the same: by wearing the same color, there’s a universal concept of inclusion.

steps.title: Guests must wear white.
steps.content: Guests must wear white. Full-white outfits are a must! Choose a white dress, suit, or other outfit based on how formal the event is, and avoid wearing other colors. [5] X Research source

steps.title: The decor is all white.
steps.content: The decor is all white. If you're hosting a white party, decorate the space with white decor. That means white tablecloths, table settings, balloons , and streamers. The elegance of the decor is up to the host—as long as it’s white, it’ll fit the theme! [6] X Research source Similarly, send out all-white invitations and serve all white-colored foods.
